feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued September 05 at 7:36PM AKDT until September 06 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range north of Black Rapids. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Streams and Rivers Through Thursday... High water will occur on rivers and streams over the Seward Peninsula and in the Kobuk and and Noatak Valleys today through Thursday. Heavy rain fell last night and today from Nome to Selawik, and heavy rain is expected tonight over the Kobuk and Noatak Valleys.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Eastern Norton Sound Coast Tonight... West winds gusting 30 over Norton Sound are causing elevated surf from Koyukuk to St Michael. This could cause minor beach erosion through tonight. The winds will turn northwest on Wednesday and the surf will decrease.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 3:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet In The Eastern Brooks Range This Week... The snow level of 4000 feet will fall to 1000 ft by Wednesday night. The Eastern Brooks Range could get 4 inches of snow above 4000 ft tonight through Wednesday night. Several inches of snow is possible below 4000 ft Wednesday night into Thursday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 3:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water on the Tanana River Continues This Week... The Tanana River continues on the Tanana River. The risk of flooding is over, and the river will fall slowly this week. Rain over the next several days will cause water levels to fluctuate slightly. People recreating or hunting on the Tanana River should be aware that many gravel bars will be covered with
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 3:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet In The Alaska Range This Week... The snow level will fall to 3000-4000 feet over the Alaska Range tonight and to 3000 feet by Wednesday night. Snow levels will stay low Thu, then start to rise on Fri. The Alaska Range near Denali could get 4 to 6 inches of snow above 3000 ft late tonight through Wednesday, while the Eastern Alaska Range could get 4

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 9:06AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TRACE ASHFALL POSSIBLE FOR UNIMAK ISLAND... As of 0900 AM this morning, satellite imagery and pilot reports indicate that an eruption is ongoing at Shishaldin Volcano. Ash is being lofted to the east-southeast, which may lead to trace amounts of ashfall downwind of the volcano, including False Pass. This statement will be updated if conditions change.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 11:27PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL MADISON AND CARROLL COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM CDT... At 1127 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Urbanette to 4 miles north of Clifty. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.

entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BENTON AND SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CDT... HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail.

The following message is transmitted on behalf of the Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division, and the Wyoming Department of Health. * WHAT...Air Quality Alert for Wildfire Smoke. * WHERE...Portions of northern and central Wyoming. This includes the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Cody Foothills; Natrona County Lower Elevations; North Big Horn Basin; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southeast Johnson County; Southwest Big Horn Basin

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 05 at 10:22AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Wyoming Air Quality Division has issued an air quality alert for wildfire smoke in effect until 1 PM MDT Wednesday... The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division, and the Wyoming Department of Health. * WHAT...Air Quality Alert for Wildfire Smoke.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills
